intro: Calamagrostis antoniana, commonly known as the fountain grass, is a perennial grass native to Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, fountain-like clusters of narrow, silver-green leaves. The plant produces panicles of pale to deep purple or pinkish flowers in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes and water features.
